description: From Anglo-Norman turnei, from Old French tornei (“tournament”), from tornoier (“to joust, tilt”).

examples: By a knight of ghostes & shadowes,I sumon’d am to Tourney.ten leagues beyond the wide worlds endmee thinke it is noe iourney.

verbs.description: tourney (third-person singular simple present tourneys, present participle tourneying, simple past and past participle tourneyed)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To take part in a tournament.
